oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of prophylactic calcium supplementation on regulators of calcium homeostasis in multiparous Holstein cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Frost, I. R.
Seely, C. R.
Callero, K. R.
Seminara, J. A.
McCray, H. A.
Reid, A. M.
Martinez, R. M.
McArt, J. A. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Post-parturient subclinical hypocalcemia (SCH) in dairy cows, a common metabolic disease which arises from the increased calcium demands of early lactation, has been associated with decreased milk production and negative health outcomes. Our objective was to determine how postpartum calcium suppleÂ­mentation methods, and the timing of their administration, affect blood calcium concentrations and regulators of calcium homeostasis, specifically parathyroid hormone and calcitonin.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 55 (2022): 2022 Annual Conference Proceedings; 192
